intro: Eriogonum visheri, commonly known as the Vishera's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Eriogonum visheri plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
